Launch your global career as a business analyst by solving real-life problems for organisations across the world. Our MSc Business Analytics programme will allow you to gain an understanding of the theory and practice behind business analytics, giving you the essential skills that employers are looking for.
In a world that is constantly going through a digital transformation, data technology has never been so important. Businesses across the globe are seeking graduates who have an understanding of business, data analytic skills and, crucially, the ability to communicate these insights to make informed business decisions.
Our MSc Business Analytics programme is suited to those from a variety of backgrounds who are interested in conducting detailed data analysis and translating these insights to resolve practical business issues for a variety of different organisations from start-ups to global companies.
You have the opportunity to take part in the award-winning Future Leaders Certificate. This extra-curricular programme gives you the chance to work on an exciting virtual live project set by a multi-national company. The Future Leaders Certificate enables you to better understand the impact technology is having on the business world and the implications for your own career.

Our MSc Business Analytics degree includes a wide variety of learning and teaching.
The course comprises of 180 credits, taught through a series of 20 credit modules and a 60 credit Capstone Project.
The modules listed below are an indication only and may be subject to change. Occasionally, it may be necessary to make changes to modules, for example, to ensure they remain current and relevant.
As a research-intensive University, our teaching is informed by the latest academic thinking and expertise of our staff. For more information on the circumstances in which the University may need to make changes to modules, please refer to the Terms and Conditions for applicants.
To gain a place at Birmingham you will need to meet our general entry requirements, as well as those specific to your course.
Your application will be reviewed by the course’s Admissions Tutor, who will decide whether your application should receive an offer.
Or postgraduate diploma from a UK university (or overseas equivalent). If you have a conditional offer for Birmingham where English is a requirement, you can take a Presessional English course as an alternative to retaking IELTS or a similar qualification. We offer on-campus courses all year round starting from September including additional online courses in the summer term.  Teaching takes place in small classes with no more than 18 students to maximise class participation.
We charge an annual tuition fee. Fees for 2025 entry are above.
The fees quoted are for one year only. For those studying courses that are longer than one year, tuition fees will also be payable in subsequent years of your programme.
Tuition fees can either be paid in full or by instalments. You can check whether you are eligible for UK or international fees with our admissions team.
Learn more about postgraduate tuition fees and funding.
International students undertaking a postgraduate taught degree are required to pay a tuition fee deposit before an electronic Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) can be issued.
To help with the cost of studies, this loan is available to all UK students. You can use this loan towards fees, maintenance or other costs at your own discretion. It’s available for all full-time, part-time and distance learning Masters programmes, as long as you don’t already have a Masters qualification (or equivalent).If you’re a student from Wales, Scotland or Northern Ireland, you can apply for Masters loans from your country’s government.
To help you afford your studies, we’ve put more than £33 million into student support and scholarships. We also offer a range of advice on searching for funding and managing your finances.
Birmingham Business School Masters Scholarships are designed to empower the next generation of leaders who are passionate about advancing responsible business and driving positive change.
For 2025, we are offering several scholarships to invest in future leaders who will set new global standards for responsible business leadership through challenging the status quo to seek progressive solutions to complex global challenges.
We want to welcome the brightest talent to our postgraduate community. That’s why our Birmingham Masters Scholarships award £3,000 to more than 300 students each year.

This programme will allow you to tackle real-world challenges, using data analysis to evaluate the success of previous business projects as well as forecast future decisions. This a skillset that is highly in demand by businesses that are looking for ways to become more efficient and increase growth.
Our MSc Business Analytics programme will also be extremely useful for those who run their own organisations, allowing you to gain an overview of the datasets available and what this means for your business.
BBS Careers is a dedicated service for Birmingham Business School students. The team provides guidance, support, and work experience opportunities, tailored to business school students, to help you succeed during and after university. We offer workshops, alumni and employer events, and 1-to-1 consultations. These will help you to develop your skills and learn how to submit high-quality internship and graduate applications.
Get ready for tomorrow, with advice, guidance and opportunities at every step of your studies. From developing new skills to preparing for a PhD, our Careers Network can help you gain an advantage in the job market or advance in your field.
Whatever you plan to do after your degree, the Careers Network offers a range of events and support services including networking opportunities, career coaching, one-to-one guidance, careers fairs and links with leading graduate recruiters. We also offer subject-specific careers consultants and a dedicated careers website for international students.
Find out why we are the most targeted UK university by top graduate employers (High Fliers report, The Graduate Market 2024) by meeting some of our successful alumni.

Description  In this module students will have the opportunity to study a package of ‘micro courses’ that they self-select based on their personal objectives. These micro courses cover practical analytics skills (such as advanced Excel modelling) as well as employment focussed skills (such as Design Thinking) and underlying data concepts such as data privacy and ethics. With guidance from the module teaching team, each student will develop a package of courses suited to their employment objectives. All students will study coding in Python. To evidence the development of their coding skills all students will keep a portfolio of completed coding tasks.The micro courses may be taught by the module team or be ‘badged’ courses from other providers including industry recognised programmes from companies such as IBM and Microsoft. Each student will prepare a package of micro courses and have these agreed by the module teaching team. Through the module students will keep a learning journal that records their development and learning. 
Learning Outcomes  By the end of the module students should be able to:Demonstrate coding skills relevant to the development of analytics applications and projects.Display and demonstrate expertise in their chosen package of micro coursesAssess their own training needs and curate learning experiences that address theseEvaluate their own learning and relate this to career objectivesEvaluate the skill sets required by employers as these relate to their own development.

My experience at Birmingham has been invaluable to kind of moving into this career path.
So, not only was I a social secretary, but also worked part time fundraising for some of the amazing initiatives Birmingham was supporting.
So that was really great for honing my sales skills, which helped me, kind of, get on to the grad scheme at PepsiCo.
I was looking for an opportunity academically to broaden my horizons that would, in the future, allow me to have that push professionally as well.
The University of Birmingham course allowed me to gain that experience.
It exposed me to so many new opportunities, to so many new contacts in the sector, that I was able to go off and meet and talk to and learn from, whilst also being able to drive that knowledge back into my role and grow personally and professionally as a result.
My time at the University has had a lasting impact on my career.

I think my journey at university really helped prepare me for my career, because of the vast amount of people that you meet at university.
I think because UOB attracts people from all over the world.

I would 100% recommend studying at UOB.

[HEADING] What can we offer you?
[HEADING] Work experience, internships and volunteering
[HEADING] Unlock your potential with Careers Network
Postgraduates from the University of Birmingham are highly sought after by employers and most find employment soon after gaining their degree.
Our aim is to help you grow intellectually and gain the skills, understanding and attributes that lead to the career you want. Whatever your motivation for postgraduate study, we are here to support you to achieve your personal goals.
Birmingham postgraduates are highly sought after. We are the most targeted UK university by top graduate employers (High Fliers report, The Graduate Market 2024), which demonstrates our commitment to you and your future.
Our University Doctoral School and Careers Network, the on-campus centre for careers and employability, offers support and expert career advice tailored to meet the diverse needs of our postgraduate community.
Whether you’re looking for a career as an academic, starting your own business or are still unsure; we have dedicated resources and services for postgraduate researchers to help you identify your career aims, contact prospective employers, and develop your skills.
Our University Doctoral School, based in Westmere house, works in association with the Careers Network to provide a variety of services that are accessible throughout the year.
We can offer you:
• One-to-one career guidance from our college-specific advisors
• CV and job application advice to help you stand out to employers
• An annual programme of careers fairs on campus to meet employers and find out about a range of opportunities available
• Employer presentations and networking sessions
• Careers workshops to improve your interview skills and help you find work experience
• Skills training for postgraduates
• Graduate mentoring
• Support and advice on setting up your own business
• Online career action planning tools and self-enrolment career development courses to use in your own time and support your career planning
• Specific support for postgraduate researchers, including events, workshops, advice sessions, socials and wellbeing events
• Work experience, internships and volunteering

Your application is specifically designed for the programme you choose to apply for and it is sensitive to the answers you provide as you proceed through the application.
Please read through the following information carefully before submitting your application. Doing so will help to avoid any unnecessary delays in processing your application.
Find the course that’s right for you by using our course finder tool.
Check the entry requirements on your chosen course page. Each course has different requirements so make sure you read these carefully.
If you're an international student, you may have slightly different entry requirements.
Apply for your course and submit any supporting documents through our online portal. You can find this on your chosen course page.
From student loans to scholarships, there are many different ways for you to fund your postgraduate study. The best place to start is our postgraduate funding database which lists all the scholarships and funding opportunities available to you.
Once you’ve applied, your application will then be reviewed by the Admissions Tutor for your course, who will decide whether your application should receive an offer.
If you are offered a place at Birmingham, you may have a Conditional Offer. This usually means that we still need some more information from you before we can accept you on to your course. This could be things like your undergraduate degree certificate, your English Language test results or a reference. However, your offer letter will outline exactly what these are. Upload these to your online portal as soon as you receive these, so that the admissions team can move your application along.
To confirm your place at Birmingham, you’ll need to accept your offer via the online portal. You can do this if you have a conditional offer or an unconditional offer.
If you are an international student, you may need to pay a £3,000 deposit to secure your place at Birmingham. You will need to pay this before your Confirmation of Acceptance for Studies (CAS) can be issued.
*This is the final deposit deadline and therefore your deposit deadline may vary. Please see your applicant portal for more details.
Please note that some individual programmes may have varying application deadlines and would therefore recommend that you check the details on the individual course pages before making your application.

If you hold an offer for one of the below programmes, you will need to follow different procedure to accept your place.
If you are in receipt of a conditional offer of a place, you will need to inform the Universities and Colleges Admissions Service (UCAS) of your decision.
To firmly accept this offer of a place you will need to reply online through the UCAS Track service at https://www.ucas.com/teaching-in-the-uk.
You will need to enter your firm and insurance choices via UCAS track.
If you do not reply by the deadline specified by UCAS, they will decline your offer by default.

Our Birmingham Masters Scholarship offers £3,000 via a tuition fee discount, to support the brightest and best applicants undertaking Masters study at Birmingham during the 2025/26 academic year.
In celebration of our 125th anniversary, we are continuing our rich tradition of supporting and welcoming the brightest students to the University by offering a £3,000 tuition fee discount through our Birmingham Masters Scholarship scheme.
Whilst maintaining our civic history, we also want you to excel at Birmingham and to stand out in an increasingly-competitive global job market once you graduate. Alongside our robust personal and academic support, we are offering the financial support to alleviate traditional barriers to postgraduate study. With the opportunity to focus on your studies, we are excited to see how you will progress our ambitious legacy to the next level.
Applications for the Birmingham Masters Scholarship closed at 23:59 (UK time) on Thursday 31 July 2025. Applicants will be updated with their outcome within three to four weeks.You can explore alternate scholarships by filtering our postgraduate funding database.
The scheme is open to all UK or Ireland students who are eligible for 'Home' fees and studying an eligible Masters degree. However, in recognition of the importance of talent retention in the Midlands, we will be prioritising applications from students who have graduated from one of the Midlands-based universities.
At Birmingham we value the regional talent that chooses to live and work in Birmingham and the surrounding areas. We understand the importance of retaining the skills, experience and knowledge of our Midlands graduates, and want to ensure finances are not a barrier to further professional development.
Due to the high volume of applications, the Birmingham Masters Scholarship will have two rounds. This is so we can process applications as and when we receive them and respond to applicants in a timely manner.
If you are made a reserve in round one, you do not need to re-apply to the scholarship scheme as your application will be automatically carried over into the second round.
Learn more about your subject area and the postgraduate student experience at Birmingham.
The Birmingham Masters Scholarships will be awarded to more than 200 candidates beginning Masters study in 2025, and awards will be based on previous academic and/or professional performance.
You are expected to attain a First-class or Upper Second-class (2:1) Honours degree (or the equivalent) for your undergraduate qualification and to provide evidence of your achievements.

Only once you have responded and accepted the scholarship will you receive the award; if you decline or do not respond by the deadline specified in your offer email, your scholarship will be reallocated.
After accepting the scholarship, you will need to accept your study offer and complete online registration to receive the £3,000 tuition fee waiver; delays in completing online registration will result in the delaying of the scholarship payment.
By accepting the scholarship you accept the terms and conditions of the Birmingham Masters Scholarship.
The Birmingham Masters Scholarship is a £3,000 fee waiver and will be applied directly to your tuition fees; the waiver cannot be exchanged for any monetary value nor can it be paid directly to you. When paying the remainder of your tuition fees, whether by direct debit (monthly or termly) or a single payment, you will only need to pay the remaining value of your tuition fees minus the £3,000 waiver. The Presessional English programme runs all year round, courses are full time, based in the UK and vary in duration. During the summer there is scope to undertake the course on a distance learning basis.

[HEADING] Engage with our students
[HEADING] Also in 'BBS Careers'
As a student of Birmingham Business School or a member of the Business School’s alumni community, you can access a bespoke service from our dedicated Business School careers team.
We are the dedicated careers service for all Birmingham Business School students and alumni.
The BBS Careers team are qualified career professionals with a wide range of experience and knowledge of the public and private sectors. We are a friendly team – ready to help you at every stage.
Meet the team
Get a head start before you join by reading our guides and resources.
If you are already a student or alumni of the Business School, visit the BBS Careers Intranet page to discover how we can help you.
BBS Careers Intranet
Are you an employer looking to work in partnership with BBS Careers? Or to recruit high-quality students or alumni with exceptional education and skills? There are several ways to work with us.
Contact the team: bbs-careers@contacts.bham.ac.uk
If you want to advertise a job or internship opportunity, please register your company on Careers Connect. Careers Connect is our dedicated career management platform.
Register on Careers Connect
Our BSc Business Management Year in Industry programme is fast becoming our largest undergraduate programme, proving extremely popular with students and employers.
Students spend their first two years studying at the Business School, then undertake a full-time paid 33 week (minimum) placement in industry and return to the University to complete their degree in the fourth year.
The MBA End of Study Internship scheme allows MBA graduates to undertake a full-time 12 week post-study internship, providing a cost effective, professional resource to help you solve a business issue, develop strategic recommendations, develop a growth plan or implement a new initiative. If you would like to discuss any ideas you may have with us, please email Yasmin Farrington.
MBA End of Study Internship case study - Naren and Jeevan.
